pull_request.title: rendering/UNIT_Grid_TEST: Fix test failure due to EXPECT_EQ on floats

update.description:
On my system (maybe because of gcc 7.2.0?)  I got the following test failures, which boil down to "don't check floats for equality". [Vector3::positionEquals](https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.10/class_ogre_1_1_vector3.html#a824cd193cc75dd39ccc74bad0cc7182d) checks for approximate equality instead.

```
#!
/home/racko/aur/gazebo/src/gazebo-8.1.1/gazebo/rendering/Grid_TEST.cc:91: Failure
Value of: Ogre::AxisAlignedBox(-count * length / 2, -count * length / 2, 0.015, count * length / 2, count * length / 2, 0.015)
  Actual: AxisAlignedBox(min=Vector3(-0.0165, -0.0165, 0.015), max=Vector3(0.0165, 0.0165, 0.015))
Expected: manualObject->getBoundingBox()
Which is: AxisAlignedBox(min=Vector3(-0.0165, -0.0165, 0.015), max=Vector3(0.0165, 0.0165, 0.015))
[Msg] Checking count [33] length [0.4]
/home/racko/aur/gazebo/src/gazebo-8.1.1/gazebo/rendering/Grid_TEST.cc:91: Failure
Value of: Ogre::AxisAlignedBox(-count * length / 2, -count * length / 2, 0.015, count * length / 2, count * length / 2, 0.015)
  Actual: AxisAlignedBox(min=Vector3(-6.6, -6.6, 0.015), max=Vector3(6.6, 6.6, 0.015))
Expected: manualObject->getBoundingBox()
Which is: AxisAlignedBox(min=Vector3(-6.6, -6.6, 0.015), max=Vector3(6.6, 6.6, 0.015))
[Msg] Checking count [33] length [9.3]
/home/racko/aur/gazebo/src/gazebo-8.1.1/gazebo/rendering/Grid_TEST.cc:91: Failure
Value of: Ogre::AxisAlignedBox(-count * length / 2, -count * length / 2, 0.015, count * length / 2, count * length / 2, 0.015)
  Actual: AxisAlignedBox(min=Vector3(-153.45, -153.45, 0.015), max=Vector3(153.45, 153.45, 0.015))
Expected: manualObject->getBoundingBox()
Which is: AxisAlignedBox(min=Vector3(-153.45, -153.45, 0.015), max=Vector3(153.45, 153.45, 0.015))
[Msg] Checking count [33] length [1000]
[Msg] Checking count [100] length [0.001]
/home/racko/aur/gazebo/src/gazebo-8.1.1/gazebo/rendering/Grid_TEST.cc:91: Failure
Value of: Ogre::AxisAlignedBox(-count * length / 2, -count * length / 2, 0.015, count * length / 2, count * length / 2, 0.015)
  Actual: AxisAlignedBox(min=Vector3(-0.05, -0.05, 0.015), max=Vector3(0.05, 0.05, 0.015))
Expected: manualObject->getBoundingBox()
Which is: AxisAlignedBox(min=Vector3(-0.05, -0.05, 0.015), max=Vector3(0.05, 0.05, 0.015))
[Msg] Checking count [100] length [0.4]
[Msg] Checking count [100] length [9.3]
/home/racko/aur/gazebo/src/gazebo-8.1.1/gazebo/rendering/Grid_TEST.cc:91: Failure
Value of: Ogre::AxisAlignedBox(-count * length / 2, -count * length / 2, 0.015, count * length / 2, count * length / 2, 0.015)
  Actual: AxisAlignedBox(min=Vector3(-465, -465, 0.015), max=Vector3(465, 465, 0.015))
Expected: manualObject->getBoundingBox()
Which is: AxisAlignedBox(min=Vector3(-465, -465, 0.015), max=Vector3(465, 465, 0.015))

```

content.raw: Just a nitpick regarding style, the variable names should be `camelCased`. But we can fix this as we merge it, thanks for the fix!

update.title: rendering/UNIT_Grid_TEST: Fix test failure due to EXPECT_EQ on floats

pull_request.title: rendering/UNIT_Grid_TEST: Fix test failure due to EXPECT_EQ on floats

pullrequest.title: rendering/UNIT_Grid_TEST: Fix test failure due to EXPECT_EQ on floats

content.raw:
thanks for the fix. Our jenkins job caught a build error and I was able to reproduce it:

~~~
/home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/rendering/Grid_TEST.cc:92:82: error: ‘box’ was not declared in this scope
       EXPECT_TRUE(box.getMinimum().positionEquals(Ogre::Vector3(-count * length / 2, -count * length / 2, 0.015)));
~~~

Adding this line should fix it:

~~~
Ogre::AxisAlignedBox box = manualObject->getBoundingBox();
~~~

Also one minor coding style issue. Can you keep the lines <= 80 chars? 

thanks!
content.html:
thanks for the fix. Our jenkins job caught a build error and I was able to reproduce it:

/home/docker/ws/src/gazebo/gazebo/rendering/Grid_TEST.cc:92:82: error: ‘box’ was not declared in this scope
       EXPECT_TRUE(box.getMinimum().positionEquals(Ogre::Vector3(-count * length / 2, -count * length / 2, 0.015)));

Adding this line should fix it:

Ogre::AxisAlignedBox box = manualObject->getBoundingBox();

Also one minor coding style issue. Can you keep the lines <= 80 chars?

thanks!
